attributes.definition: A data matrix is applicable if each object has the same fixed set of numeric attributes. Data can be converted into a data matrix if it can be represented by meaningful numbers, typically in a numerical attribute format that allows for ratio operations, ensuring all values are ratio data.
attributes.simplified_explanation: A data matrix is a way to organize data where each item has the same set of numerical features, and these numbers can be compared using ratios.

attributes.definition: Sparsity occurs when a dataset has a very large number of features or potential data points, but only a small fraction of them actually have values. This is common in scenarios with millions of items but only a few interactions or selections per item.
attributes.simplified_explanation: Sparsity means that most of the possible information in a dataset is missing or empty, like having a huge grid but only a few cells filled in.

attributes.takeaway: When dealing with sparse data, the scale at which you analyze it can reveal different patterns.
